items.title: Labor and Coalition on path to deal on hate laws reform as deadline looms
items.description: Liberal MPs gathered to discuss the draft laws at a partyroom meeting in Canberra on Monday evening after Opposition Leader Sussan Ley and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese met to hash out an agreement.

items.title: Live: Parliament returns to debate gun reform, hate laws in response to Bondi attack
items.description: Parliament returns to consider legislation on stricter gun controls and hate speech in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. Follow live.

items.title: 'There’ll be more': Shark warning after three attacks in Sydney in 24 hours
items.description: A public policy shark expert says sewage leaking into the harbour after heavy rainfall is attracting bait fish followed by sharks.

items.title: First Nations employee asked by supervisor about eating ants takes transport department to court
items.description: A First Nations employee at South Australia's Department for Infrastructure and Transport (DIT) has claimed she was sexually harassed by her supervisor and racially discriminated against when asked about eating ants before a cultural training session, court documents reveal.

items.title: The eerie calm over global stocks may be about to shatter
items.description: There are signs Donald Trump's bold strategy to artificially lower interest rates could backfire, as a level of disquiet emerges on money markets, particularly in bonds.

items.title: Trump links Greenland threats to Nobel Peace Prize snub
items.description: President Donald Trump sends a text message to Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre saying he "no longer [feels] an obligation to think purely of Peace" after being denied the prize by the Nobel Committee.

items.title: Women's football captain departs club after men's offensive 'Silly Saturday' costumes
items.description: A women's senior football captain has stepped away from her local club after photos of the senior men's leadership team were posted online during their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations.

items.title: Swimmers urged to check pollution in Port Phillip Bay before diving in
items.description: Victoria's Environment Protection Authority says people wanting to cool off at Port Phillip Bay beaches this summer should stay across its regular pollution updates.

items.title: Call that likely saved deputy mayor's life almost went unanswered
items.description: A mayor's split-second decision to answer a phone call instead of heading into the surf may well have saved the life of his deputy.

items.title: NDIS provider hit with $1.1m penalty over hundreds of compliance failures
items.description: Oak Tasmania admits to 474 compliance and reporting failures, as well as breaches that resulted in the hospitalisation of multiple NDIS clients.

items.title: Popyrin says he 'can't keep going on like this' after crushing defeat
items.description: Alexei Popyrin concedes he will look inwards once again to think about his career after a crushing loss sent him out of the Australian Open in the first round.

items.title: China ramps up crackdown on 'underground' Christian churches
items.description: Dozens of church leaders and members have been arrested in China in recent months, which advocates say is indicative of intensifying persecution.

items.title: China's population drops for fourth year as fewer babies born
items.description: National data shows that in 2025, China's population shrunk by 3.39 million people, as experts warn the trend is likely to continue.

items.title: What we know so far about Spain's fatal high-speed train crash
items.description: Spanish authorities have declared three days of mourning after two trains collided on a track south of Madrid, killing at least 40 people.

items.title: Starlink able to help Iranians in 'digital prison', but its monopoly poses a risk
items.description: In Iran, Starlink has provided a line to the outside world, but now there are fears about such vital technology being in the hands of one company.

items.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93 in Rome
items.description: The fashion icon's creations were adored by Hollywood stars, royals and first ladies for his fail-safe red carpet designs.

items.title: Rockhampton residents prepare for flooding from ex-Cyclone Koji
items.description: Flooding on the Fitzroy River will be less severe than originally forecast, however about 280 properties could still be impacted.

items.title: Residents of 'dumping capital' frustrated as nickel waste stored near homes
items.description: The dumping of the waste is the latest in a series of similar events for the city which some now call "Australia’s waste capital".

items.title: How powerlifting made me feel good at sport
items.description: As a child, Julie "wasn't one of the sporty kids". A safe gym environment and then a supportive powerlifting community helped her realise that wasn't actually true.

items.title: Former Labor strategist Tim Picton dies after alleged assault
items.description: Former Labor strategist Tim Picton dies in hospital, weeks after he was allegedly assaulted outside a Perth nightclub.

items.title: Qld government won't support federal gun buyback, ABC understands
items.description: The ABC understands Queensland will join the Northern Territory and Tasmania in rejecting a national gun buyback scheme.

items.title: 'Evil and sick': Bondi shooting survivor speaks out after losing his father
items.description: Ya'akov Tetleroyd's father died in the Bondi Beach shootings. He nearly lost his arm as a result of being shot, yet he told 7.30 in an exclusive interview that he forgives the gunmen.

items.title: Victorian bushfires squeeze beekeeper access to high-quality trees
items.description: Apiarists in Victoria are wondering how they will keep their bees fed during winter after bushfires two years in a row render certain areas inaccessible.

items.title: Land council 'appalled' at 'racist' tweets by incoming NT administrator
items.description: Former Northern Territory Cattlemen’s Association president David Connolly is set to be sworn in as NT administrator next month, but the emergence of past social media posts have led to calls for his appointment to be blocked.

items.title: Author's lawyer serves second concerns notice to SA premier
items.description: Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says her lawyer has served a second concerns notice for defamation on South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas.
